newsitem.title: ITALY: FORECAST - Italy seen issuing 37 trln lire Bots.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - Italy seen issuing 37 trln lire Bots.

text.p: The Italian Treasury is expected to offer a lower amount of short term bills (Bots) at its month end auction than that expiring, while analysts expect 2.5 trillion lire of zero coupon certificates (Ctzs) to be offered.

Economists polled by Reuters forecast the Treasury will offer between 36.75 and 37.5 trillion lire of Bots, against 38.25 trillion expiring, when it details later today the sums for auction on August 27.
The quantity of three-month Bots particularly is expected to be below the 12.25 trillion expiring.
Yields are expected either to be stable or rise slightly given difficult market conditions and upward pressure on short term rates.
